$interpreted: Fredrica: Whew〜Finally, almost finished〜
Fredrica: After the distinguished guests greet the Princess, it's the coronation ceremony. Is the security all set to go?
Jerome: It's all been handled. But more importantly, it's quite rare we get to see the general work this long without a single word of complaint.
Fredrica: Hehe...well, there's really only one reason for that; Her Highness has allowed me to go on a long vacation after today's work.
Fredrica: For that, no matter how utterly exhausted I am, I have to at least pretend I'm working hard~
Jerome: ......
Fredrica: Alright then, the last distinguished guests are...the Desert Bazaar's representatives〜
Sherlock: Hello, hello. This is my invitation card, and beside me is the President of the Desert Bazaar Chamber of Commerce,
Sherlock: Karen Arla Fernandez.
Jerome: There's no issue with the invitation. In accordance with customs, we must check the Princess' gift.
Upset Noble: Angelia has no right to be our King!
Upset Noble: William's daughter is not capable of bringing glory to this Kingdom. Step down! STEP DOWN!
Fredrica: These damn morons! Are they trying to ruin my vacation!? Stop them right away!
Fredrica: My vacation nearly slipped away, thank you〜
Fredrica: Hey handsome, put those thugs in custody!
Jerome: General, we've yet to check their present.
Fredrica: It's not an issue. A quick look shall suffice, right?
Fredrica: An exquisite ruby accessory, that's all. No big deal〜Please, enter. We still have to deal with these troublemakers.
Angelia: Sir Sherlock, it's been so long. I didn't expect you to bring President Karen along with you as well〜
Sherlock: I didn't really want to...she just kind of tagged along.
Angelia: President Karen, I was unable to properly introduce myself last time I visited the Desert Bazaar. Apologies.
Karen: Don't be so modest, please. This is a gift I personally selected for the new Queen of the Kingdom of the Sun.
Angelia: What a beautiful necklace.
Karen: This is a scarlet ruby from the depths of the desert. It's extremely valuable, and I must say it really sets off the radiance of your coronation.
Angelia: That is so kind of you. From the bottom of my heart, thank you.
Karen: Please, when you wear it, you must be careful not to be too rough with it.
Sherlock: Such an expensive necklace. It'd be much better off if it were given to me...
Sherlock: By the way, isn't she a little too~ concerned? Rubies are extremely sturdy, and it's not like it's a Blazetail Lizard counterfeit...
Sherlock: Whaaaa! No, it can't be...
Sherlock: Look out!!!
Angelia: Is something wrong?
Sherlock: (Huh, nothing's happened, perhaps I'm overthinking it...)
Sherlock: Oh, nothing. I'm just saying it's a really expensive necklace, so it's best not to toss it about.
Naya: You darn tin can, you trying to freak everybody out?
Angelia: President Karen, I really appreciate this. This necklace is truly breathtaking.
Angelia: The coronation ceremony is about to begin. You two, please remain here. There will be a banquet for the guests after the ceremony finishes.
Karen: I'm afraid I can't stay. Business in the Bazaar changes in a flash, so I must go back. Sherlock won't be of any use, so he'll stay here in my place.
Karen: Please excuse my absence.
Karen: Princess, there's a species of wolf in the desert. In every pack, there is only one leader allowed.
Karen: As soon as the leader shows any sign of weakness, the other wolves will challenge and replace it.
Angelia: Umm...what exactly are you saying?
Karen: My blessing to you, Princess. May you forever reign as the strongest leader.
Naya: Who the hell talks like that? She really is a freaking weirdo.
Angelia: That's strange. Her words of congratulations...they sounded like something Uncle Theodore would say...
Angelia: Just now, it's as if...the words...came directly out of his mouth...

Model.Text: Whew〜Finally, almost finished〜
After the distinguished guests greet the Princess, it's the coronation ceremony. Is the security all set to go?
It's all been handled. But more importantly, it's quite rare we get to see the general work this long without a single word of complaint.
Hehe...well, there's really only one reason for that; Her Highness has allowed me to go on a long vacation after today's work.
For that, no matter how utterly exhausted I am, I have to at least pretend I'm working hard~
Alright then, the last distinguished guests are...the Desert Bazaar's representatives〜
Hello, hello. This is my invitation card, and beside me is the President of the Desert Bazaar Chamber of Commerce,
Karen Arla Fernandez.
There's no issue with the invitation. In accordance with customs, we must check the Princess' gift.
Angelia has no right to be our King!
William's daughter is not capable of bringing glory to this Kingdom. Step down! STEP DOWN!
These damn morons! Are they trying to ruin my vacation!? Stop them right away!
My vacation nearly slipped away, thank you〜
Hey handsome, put those thugs in custody!
General, we've yet to check their present.
It's not an issue. A quick look shall suffice, right?
An exquisite ruby accessory, that's all. No big deal〜Please, enter. We still have to deal with these troublemakers.
Sir Sherlock, it's been so long. I didn't expect you to bring President Karen along with you as well〜
I didn't really want to...she just kind of tagged along.
President Karen, I was unable to properly introduce myself last time I visited the Desert Bazaar. Apologies.
Don't be so modest, please. This is a gift I personally selected for the new Queen of the Kingdom of the Sun.
What a beautiful necklace.
This is a scarlet ruby from the depths of the desert. It's extremely valuable, and I must say it really sets off the radiance of your coronation.
That is so kind of you. From the bottom of my heart, thank you.
Please, when you wear it, you must be careful not to be too rough with it.
Such an expensive necklace. It'd be much better off if it were given to me...
By the way, isn't she a little too~ concerned? Rubies are extremely sturdy, and it's not like it's a Blazetail Lizard counterfeit...
Whaaaa! No, it can't be...
Look out!!!
Is something wrong?
(Huh, nothing's happened, perhaps I'm overthinking it...)
Oh, nothing. I'm just saying it's a really expensive necklace, so it's best not to toss it about.
You darn tin can, you trying to freak everybody out?
President Karen, I really appreciate this. This necklace is truly breathtaking.
The coronation ceremony is about to begin. You two, please remain here. There will be a banquet for the guests after the ceremony finishes.
I'm afraid I can't stay. Business in the Bazaar changes in a flash, so I must go back. Sherlock won't be of any use, so he'll stay here in my place.
Please excuse my absence.
Princess, there's a species of wolf in the desert. In every pack, there is only one leader allowed.
As soon as the leader shows any sign of weakness, the other wolves will challenge and replace it.
Umm...what exactly are you saying?
My blessing to you, Princess. May you forever reign as the strongest leader.
Who the hell talks like that? She really is a freaking weirdo.
That's strange. Her words of congratulations...they sounded like something Uncle Theodore would say...
Just now, it's as if...the words...came directly out of his mouth...
